variable.name: subject_ID
variable.description: Unique individual coded ID.

variable.name: case_control
variable.description: Indicates whether the participant has Parkinson's disease (case) or (control).

variable.name: site
variable.description: Recruitment site.

variable.name: gender
variable.description: Self reported male or female.

variable.name: age_blood_draw
variable.description: Participant's age when blood was drawn for DNA extraction.
variable.comment: To protect identity, participants who were 90 years or older at blood draw are coded as 90.

variable.name: age_onset
variable.description: Age at PD onset.
variable.comment: To protect identity, participants who were 90 years or older at onset are coded as 90.

variable.name: age_dx
variable.description: Age at PD diagnosis.
variable.comment: To protect identity, participants who were 90 years or older at diagnosis are coded as 90.

variable.name: source_of_DNA
variable.description: Biological source of DNA.

variable.name: ethnicity_NIH
variable.description: Self report of ethnicity, per NIH classification.

variable.name: race_NIH
variable.description: Self report of race, per NIH classification.
variable.value: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

variable.name: family_history
variable.description: Family history of PD.
variable.value: PD in second (but not first) degree relative
PD in third (but not first or second) degree relative
PD in fourth (but not first, second or third) degree relative

variable.name: ancestry_father
variable.description: Country or continent from which participant's paternal ancestors immigrated to the United States.

variable.name: ancestry_mother
variable.description: Country or continent from which participant's maternal ancestors immigrated to United States.

variable.name: age_death
variable.description: Age at death.
variable.comment: To protect identity, participants who were 90 years or older at death are coded as 90.

variable.name: autopsy_dx
variable.description: Diagnosis after brain autopsy.
variable.value: Lewy body variant of AD; final consensus diagnosis is PD

variable.name: Environmental_Exposure_Data
variable.description: Does participant have smoking, caffeine and/or (non-aspirin) non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug data.

variable.name: Age_at_Environmental_Data_Collection
variable.description: Participant's age when smoking, caffeine, and/or (non-aspirin) non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug data were collected.
variable.comment: To protect identity, participants who were 90 years or older when data were collected are coded as 90.

variable.name: smoking_ever_never
variable.description: Did participant smoke 100 or more cigarettes in lifetime?
variable.comment: Ever/never smoking was collected either by NGRC_EEQ, a different questionnaire or by interview.
variable.value: Did not smoke at least 100 cigarettes in the lifetime (Never)
Did smoke at least 100 cigarettes in the lifetime (Ever)

variable.name: smoking_load
variable.description: Lifetime cigarette use.

variable.name: smoking_status
variable.description: Participant's smoking history.

variable.name: coffee_ever_never
variable.description: Did participant ever consume caffeinated coffee?
variable.comment: Ever/never coffee was collected either by NGRC_EEQ, a different questionnaire or by interview.

variable.name: coffee_load
variable.description: Lifetime caffeinated coffee consumption.

variable.name: coffee_low_high
variable.description: Is participant's lifetime caffeinated coffee consumption low or high?
variable.comment: Low or High split at 67.5 coffee cup-years (median of controls).
variable.value: Consumed less than or equal to median (Low Coffee)

variable.name: tea_ever_never
variable.description: Did participant ever consume caffeinated tea?

variable.name: soda_ever_never
variable.description: Did participant ever consume caffeinated soda?

variable.name: NSAIDs_OTC_ever_never
variable.description: Did participant ever consume over the counter (non-aspirin) non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs?
variable.value: Never used over the counter (non-aspirin) non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs
Ever used over the counter (non-aspirin) non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs

variable.name: NSAIDs_OTC_load
variable.description: Lifetime over the counter (non-aspirin) non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug consumption.

variable.name: NSAIDs_Rx_ever_never
variable.description: Did participant ever consume prescription (non-aspirin) non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs?
variable.value: Never used prescription (non-aspirin) non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs
Ever used prescription (non-aspirin) non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs

variable.name: NSAIDs_Rx_load
variable.description: Lifetime prescription (non-aspirin) non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug consumption.

variable.name: LRRK2_G2019S
variable.description: LRRK2 G2019S genotype.

variable.name: APOE_e2e3e4
variable.description: APOE e2e3e4 genotype.

variable.name: MAPT_H1H2
variable.description: MAPT H1H2 diplotype.
variable.comment: H1H2 diplotypes determined from MAPT IVS3+9 genotypes.

variable.name: SNCA_REP1
variable.description: SNCA REP1 repeat length genotype.

variable.name: CYP2D6*4
variable.description: CYP2D6 *4 carrier status.

variable.name: MMSE
variable.description: Participants with a Mini Mental State Exam score.
variable.value: Mini Mental State Exam not administered

variable.name: MMSE_age
variable.description: Age at Mini Mental State Exam.
variable.comment: To protect identity, participants who were 90 years or older at exam are coded as 90.

variable.name: MMSE_in-person
variable.description: Mini Mental State Exam score administered in-person.
variable.comment: The most recent in-person administered Mini Mental State Exam is reported.

variable.name: MMSE_telephone
variable.description: Mini Mental State Exam score administered by telephone.
variable.comment: Telephone administered Mini Mental State Exam is reported only if no in-person exam was ever administered. If more than one telephone exam, the most recent is reported.

variable.name: UPDRS
variable.description: Participants with a Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale score.
variable.value: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale not administered
Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale administered

variable.name: UPDRS_age
variable.description: Age when Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale was administered.
variable.comment: To protect identity, participants who were 90 years or older at exam are coded as 90.

variable.name: Intellectual_Impairment
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating level of intellectual impairment during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part I.
variable.value: Mild. Consistent forgetfulness with partial recollection of events and no other difficulties.
Moderate memory loss, with disorientation and moderate difficulty handling complex problems. Mild but definite impairment of function at home with need of occasional prompting.
Severe memory loss with disorientation for time and often place. Severe impairment in handling problems.
Severe memory loss with orientation preserved to person only. Unable to make judgments or solve problems. Requires much help or personal care. Cannot be left alone at all.

variable.name: Thought_Disorder
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating level of thought disorders during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part I.
variable.value: Occasional to frequent hallucinations or delusions; without insight; could interfere with daily activities
Persistent hallucinations, delusions, or florid psychosis; not able to care for self.

variable.name: Depression
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating level of depression during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part I.
variable.value: Periods of sadness or guilt greater than normal, never sustained for days or weeks.
Sustained depression with vegetative symptoms (insomnia, anorexia, weight loss, loss of interest).
Sustained depression with vegetative symptoms and suicidal thoughts or intent.

variable.name: Motivation_Initiative
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating level of motivation/initiative during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part I.
variable.value: Less assertive than usual; more passive.
Loss of initiative or disinterest in elective (non-routine) activities.
Loss of initiative or disinterest in day-to-day routine activities.

variable.name: Speech
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating level of speech function during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part II.
variable.value: Mildly affected. No difficulty being understood.
Moderately affected. Sometimes asked to repeat statements.
Severely affected. Frequently asked to repeat statements.

variable.name: Salivation
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating level of salivation during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part II.
variable.value: Slight but definite excess of saliva in mouth; may have nighttime drooling.
Moderately excessive saliva; may have minimal drooling.
Marked excessive saliva with some drooling.
Marked drooling, requires constant tissue or handkerchief.

variable.name: Swallowing
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating level of swallowing function during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part II.
variable.value: Requires nasogastric tube or gastrostomy feeding.

variable.name: Handwriting
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating level of handwriting function during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part II.
variable.value: Moderately slow or small; all words legible.
Severely affected; not all words legible.
The majority of words not legible.

variable.name: Cutting_Food_and_Handling_Utensils
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating level of food cutting and utensil handling function during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part II.
variable.value: Somewhat slow and clumsy, but no help needed.
Can cut most foods although clumsy and slow; some help needed.
Food must be cut by someone, but can still feed slowly.

variable.name: Dressing
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating level of dressing function during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part II.
variable.value: Somewhat slow, but no help needed.
Occasional assistance with buttoning, getting arms in sleeves.
Considerable help required, but can do some things alone.

variable.name: Hygiene
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating level of hygienic function during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part II.
variable.value: Somewhat slow, but no help needed.
Needs help to shower or bathe; or very slow in hygienic care.
Requires assistance for washing, brushing teeth, combing hair, going to the bathroom.
Foley catheter or other mechanical aids.

variable.name: Turning_in_Bed_and_Adjusting_Bedclothes
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating level of ability to turn in bed during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part II.
variable.value: Somewhat slow and clumsy, but no help needed.
Can turn or adjust sheets, but with great difficulty.
Can initiate, but not turn or adjust sheets alone.

variable.name: Falling_Unrelated_to_Freezing
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating frequency of falling (not related to freezing) during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part II.
variable.value: Occasional falls, less than once per day.
Falls on average of once daily.

variable.name: Freezing_when_Walking
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating frequency of freezing during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part II.
variable.value: Rare freezing when walking; may have start hesitation.
Frequent freezing. Occasional falls from freezing.

variable.name: Walking
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating walking ability during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part II.
variable.value: Mild difficulty. May not swing arms or may tend to drag leg.
Moderate difficulty, but requires little or no assistance.
Severe disturbance of walking, requiring assistance.
Cannot walk at all, even with assistance.

variable.name: Tremor
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating presence of tremors during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part II.

variable.name: Sensory_Complaints_Related_to_Parkinsonism
variable.description: Participant's response to interview, indicating sensory symptoms due to PD during the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part II.
variable.value: Occasionally has numbness, tingling, or mild aching.
Frequently has numbness, tinging, or aching; not distressing.

variable.name: PD_state_during_UPDRS_Part_III_motor_exam
variable.description: Was participant "On" or "Off" during part III UPDRS exam?
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.

variable.name: Speech_Observed
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for speech ability while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Slight loss of expression, diction, and/or volume
Monotone, slurred but understandable, moderately impaired.

variable.name: Facial_Expression
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for facial expression while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Minimal hypomimia, could be normal "Poker Face".
Slight but definitely abnormal diminution of facial expression.
Moderate hypomimia; lips parted some of the time.
Masked or fixed facies with severe or complete loss of expression; lips parted 1/4' inch or more.

variable.name: Tremor_at_Rest_Face_Lips_Chin
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for resting tremor in face, lips, and chin while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Mild in amplitude and persistent. Or moderate in amplitude, but only intermittently present.
Moderate in amplitude and present most of the time.
Marked in amplitude and present most of the time.

variable.name: Tremor_at_Rest_Right_Hand
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for resting tremor in right hand while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Mild in amplitude and persistent. Or moderate in amplitude, but only intermittently present.
Moderate in amplitude and present most of the time.
Marked in amplitude and present most of the time.

variable.name: Tremor_at_Rest_Left_Hand
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for resting tremor in left hand while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Mild in amplitude and persistent. Or moderate in amplitude, but only intermittently present.
Moderate in amplitude and present most of the time.
Marked in amplitude and present most of the time.

variable.name: Tremor_at_Rest_Right_Foot
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for resting tremor in right foot while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Mild in amplitude and persistent. Or moderate in amplitude, but only intermittently present.
Moderate in amplitude and present most of the time.
Marked in amplitude and present most of the time.

variable.name: Tremor_at_Rest_Left_Foot
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for resting tremor in left foot while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Mild in amplitude and persistent. Or moderate in amplitude, but only intermittently present.
Moderate in amplitude and present most of the time.
Marked in amplitude and present most of the time.

variable.name: Action_or_Postural_Tremor_of_Right_Hand
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for action tremor in right hand while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Moderate in amplitude; present with action.
Moderate in amplitude with posture holding as well as action.
Marked in amplitude; interferes with feeding.

variable.name: Action_or_Postural_Tremor_of_Left_Hand
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for action tremor in left hand while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Moderate in amplitude; present with action.
Moderate in amplitude with posture holding as well as action.
Marked in amplitude; interferes with feeding.

variable.name: Rigidity_Neck
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for rigidity in passive movement of neck with participant relaxed in sitting position while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Slight or detectable only when activated by other movements.
Marked, but full range of motion easily achieved.
Severe, range of motion achieved with difficulty.

variable.name: Rigidity_RUE
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for rigidity in passive movement of upper right extremity with participant relaxed in sitting position while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Slight or detectable only when activated by other movements.
Marked, but full range of motion easily achieved.
Severe, range of motion achieved with difficulty.

variable.name: Rigidity_LUE
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for rigidity in passive movement of upper left extremity with participant relaxed in sitting position while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Slight or detectable only when activated by other movements.
Marked, but full range of motion easily achieved.
Severe, range of motion achieved with difficulty.

variable.name: Rigidity_RLE
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for rigidity in passive movement of lower right extremity with participant relaxed in sitting position while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Slight or detectable only when activated by other movements.
Marked, but full range of motion easily achieved.
Severe, range of motion achieved with difficulty.

variable.name: Rigidity_LLE
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for rigidity in passive movement of lower left extremity with participant relaxed in sitting position while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Slight or detectable only when activated by other movements.
Marked, but full range of motion easily achieved.
Severe, range of motion achieved with difficulty.

variable.name: Finger_Taps_Right_Hand
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for tapping of right thumb with index finger in rapid succession with widest amplitude possible while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Mild slowing and/or reduction in amplitude.
Moderately impaired. Definite and early fatiguing. May have occasional arrests in movement.
Severely impaired. Frequent hesitation in initiating movements or arrests in ongoing movement.

variable.name: Finger_Taps_Left_Hand
variable.description: Participant's score as determined by examiner for tapping of left thumb with index finger in rapid succession with widest amplitude possible while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Mild slowing and/or reduction in amplitude.
Moderately impaired. Definite and early fatiguing. May have occasional arrests in movement.
Severely impaired. Frequent hesitation in initiating movements or arrests in ongoing movement.

variable.name: Hand_Movements_Right_Hand
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for opening and closing right hand in rapid succession with widest amplitude possible while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Mild slowing and/or reduction in amplitude.
Moderately impaired. Definite and early fatiguing. May have occasional arrests in movement.
Severely impaired. Frequent hesitation in initiating movements or arrests in ongoing movement.

variable.name: Hand_Movements_Left_Hand
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for opening and closing left hand in rapid succession with widest amplitude possible while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Mild slowing and/or reduction in amplitude.
Moderately impaired. Definite and early fatiguing. May have occasional arrests in movement.
Severely impaired. Frequent hesitation in initiating movements or arrests in ongoing movement.

variable.name: Rapid_Alternating_Movements_of_Right_Hand
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for right hand pronation-supination movements, vertically or horizontally, with as large an amplitude as possible, both hands moving simultaneously while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Mild slowing and/or reduction in amplitude.
Moderately impaired. Definite and early fatiguing. May have occasional arrests in movement.
Severely impaired. Frequent hesitation in initiating movements or arrests in ongoing movement.

variable.name: Rapid_Alternating_Movements_of_Left_Hand
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for left hand pronation-supination movements, largest amplitude possible, both hands simultaneously while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Mild slowing and/or reduction in amplitude.
Moderately impaired. Definite and early fatiguing. May have occasional arrests in movement.
Severely impaired. Frequent hesitation in initiating movements or arrests in ongoing movement.

variable.name: Right_Leg_Agility
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for tapping right heel on ground in rapid succession by lifting entire leg while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Mild slowing and/or reduction in amplitude.
Moderately impaired. Definite and early fatiguing. May have occasional arrests in movement.
Severely impaired. Frequent hesitation in initiating movements or arrests in ongoing movement.

variable.name: Left_Leg_Agility
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for tapping left heel on ground in rapid succession by lifting entire leg while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Mild slowing and/or reduction in amplitude.
Moderately impaired. Definite and early fatiguing. May have occasional arrests in movement.
Severely impaired. Frequent hesitation in initiating movements or arrests in ongoing movement.

variable.name: Arising_from_Chair
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for attempting to rise from straight-back wood or metal chair with arms folded across chest while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Slow; or may need more than one attempt.
Pushes self up from arms of seat.
Tends to fall back and may have to try more than one time, but can get up without help.

variable.name: Posture
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for posture while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Not quite erect, slightly stooped posture; could be normal for older person.
Moderately stooped posture; definitely abnormal; can be slightly leaning to one side.
Severely stooped posture with kyphosis; can be moderately leaning to one side.
Marked flexion with extreme abnormality of posture.

variable.name: Gait
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for gait while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Walks slowly, may shuffle with short steps, but no festination or propulsion.
Walks with difficulty, but requires little or no assistance; may have some festination, short steps, or propulsion.
Severe disturbance of gait, requiring assistance.
Cannot walk at all, even with assistance.

variable.name: Postural_Stability
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for response to sudden posterior displacement produced by pull on shoulders when participant is erect, with eyes open and feet slightly apart (subject is prepared) while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Absence of postural response; would fall if not caught by examiner.
Very unstable, tends to lose balance spontaneously.

variable.name: Body_Bradykinesia_and_Hypokinesia
variable.description: Participant's score determined by examiner for combining slowness, hesitancy, decreased arm swing, small amplitude, and poverty of movement in general while participant is in "on" or "off" state.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part III.
variable.value: Minimal slowness, giving movement a deliberate character; could be normal for some persons. Possibly reduced amplitude.
Mild degree of slowness and poverty of movement which is definitely abnormal. Alternatively, some reduced amplitude.
Moderate slowness, poverty, or small amplitude of movement.
Marked slowness, poverty, or small amplitude of movement.

variable.name: Dyskinesia_Duration
variable.description: Participant's response to examiner's question: "What proportion of the waking day are dyskinesias present?", in the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part IV.

variable.name: Dyskinesia_Disability
variable.description: Participant's response to examiner's question, "How disabling are the dyskinesias?", in the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part IV.

variable.name: Dyskinesia_Pain
variable.description: Participant's response to question, "How painful are the dyskinesias?", in the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part IV.

variable.name: Presence_of_early_morning_dystonia
variable.description: Participant's response to the examiner's question about the presence or absence of early morning dystonia in the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part IV.

variable.name: Clinical_Fluctuations_Predictable
variable.description: Participant's response to examiner's question, "Are any "off" periods predictable as to timing after a dose of medication?", in the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part IV.

variable.name: Clinical_Fluctuations_Unpredictable
variable.description: Participant's response to examiner's question, "Are any "off" periods unpredictable as to timing after a dose of medication?", in the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part IV.

variable.name: Clinical_Fluctuations_Sudden
variable.description: Participant's response to examiner's question, "Do any of the "off" periods come on suddenly?", in the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part IV.

variable.name: Clinical_Fluctuations_Duration
variable.description: Participant's response to examiner's question of what portion of the waking day participant is "off" on average in the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part IV.

variable.name: Anorexia_Nausea_Vomiting
variable.description: Participant's response to examiner's question of whether or not the participant had anorexia, nausea, or vomiting in the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part IV.

variable.name: Sleep_Disturbances
variable.description: Participant's response to examiner's question of whether or not the participant had sleep disturbances in the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part IV.

variable.name: Symptomatic_Orthostasis
variable.description: Participant's response to examiner's question of whether or not the participant had symptomatic orthostasis in the past week.
variable.comment: Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating Scale Part IV.

variable.name: Dx_by_UKBB_criteria
variable.description: Was subject diagnosed as having PD according to modified UK-Brain Bank criteria? (Modified only not to exclude based on positive family history.)

variable.name: UKBB_individual_criteria
variable.description: Subjects with individual UK Brain Bank criteria

variable.name: UKBB_Bradykinesia
variable.description: Bradykinesia (slowness of initiation of voluntary movement with progressive reduction in speed and amplitude of repetitive actions)
variable.comment: UKBB clinical diagnostic criteria Step 1: Diagnosis of Parkinsonian Syndrome

variable.name: UKBB_Rigidity
variable.description: Muscular rigidity
variable.comment: UKBB clinical diagnostic criteria Step 1: Diagnosis of Parkinsonian Syndrome

variable.name: UKBB_Resting_Tremor
variable.description: 4-6 Hz rest tremor
variable.comment: UKBB clinical diagnostic criteria Step 1: Diagnosis of Parkinsonian Syndrome

variable.name: UKBB_Postural_Instability
variable.description: Postural instability not caused by primary visual, vestibular, cerebellar, or proprioceptive dysfunction
variable.comment: UKBB clinical diagnostic criteria Step 1: Diagnosis of Parkinsonian Syndrome
variable.value: Unknown - the physician did not have enough information to definitively check yes or no.

variable.name: UKBB_Exclusion_Criteria
variable.description: Subject has any of the following exclusion criteria for Parkinson's disease: history of repeated strokes with stepwise progression of parkinsonian features; history of repeated head injury; history of definite encephalitis; oculogyric crises; neuroleptic treatment at onset of symptoms; sustained remission; strictly unilateral features after 3 years; Supranuclear gaze palsy; cerebellar signs; early severe autonomic involvement; Early severe dementia with disturbances of memory, language, and praxis; babinski sign; Presence of cerebral tumor or communication hydrocephalus on CT scan; negative response to large doses of levodopa (if malabsorption excluded); MPTP exposure
variable.comment: UK Brain Bank clinical diagnostic criteria Step 2: Exclusion criteria for Parkinson's disease

variable.name: UKBB_Unilateral_Onset
variable.description: Unilateral onset
variable.comment: UK Brain Bank clinical diagnostic criteria Step 3: supportive prospective positive criteria for Parkinson's disease
variable.value: Unknown - the physician did not have enough information to definitively check yes or no.

variable.name: UKBB_Progressive_disorder
variable.description: Progressive disorder
variable.comment: UK Brain Bank clinical diagnostic criteria Step 3: supportive prospective positive criteria for Parkinson's disease

variable.name: UKBB_Persistent_asymetry_affecting_side_of_onset_most
variable.description: Persistent asymmetry affecting side of onset most
variable.comment: UK Brain Bank clinical diagnostic criteria Step 3: supportive prospective positive criteria for Parkinson's disease
variable.value: Unknown - the physician did not have enough information to definitively check yes or no.

variable.name: UKBB_Excellent_response_(70_100%)_to_levodopa_or_dopamine_agonist
variable.description: Excellent response (70-100%) to levodopa or dopamine agonist
variable.comment: UK Brain Bank clinical diagnostic criteria Step 3: supportive prospective positive criteria for Parkinson's disease
variable.value: Unknown - the physician did not have enough information to definitively check yes or no.

variable.name: UKBB_Severe_levodopa_induced_chorea
variable.description: Severe levodopa-induced chorea
